name: Asalem

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at Asalem in Dec 2012 and had a lovely time. It was the last stop of a year-long trip in Latin America, so we splurged and treated ourselves to this little bit of paradise.
reviews.title: Best place on the island

reviews.text: The standard rooms aren't the newest... I personally think for the price they could be updated. However the bed was insanely comfortable! And we had a great terrace overlooking the sea. The view cannot be beaten.
reviews.title: Overvalued and pretentious

reviews.text: We spent our four days there mainly walking 15mins through the forest to a beautiful beach... begins with A... can't remember the actual name! But this was the easiest and most relaxing way to get on the beach. Otherwise you have to take a water taxi everywhere which can add up.
reviews.title: Great location, friendly helpful staff, chilled out feeling

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We did take a boat out to one beach - Lopes Mendes. Highly recommend doing this. Probably the best beach I've ever seen!! And I've seen quite a few! Clear, turquoise water, great waves to jump in, white sand. Just beautiful!
reviews.title: hidden paradise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The restaurant at Asalem was also brilliant. We tried a couple of other restaurants in town, and also the restaurant at the Sagu resort (rubbish) and Asalem was by far the best. You have to pre-order your food as they only have one chef, and it's all cooked freshly that evening. But it's certainly worth waiting for. The fish in coconut milk is just devine. And you're eating, relatively on your own (the restaurant only sits about 8 people) and it's just you, the sea, candlelit tables... and your amazing food!
reviews.title: Little Gem....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In a beautiful place like Ilha Grande, ideally you need to book a pousada which complements the location. Asalem does just that, with a beautiful view and set so you can jump straight into the water, swim to or take a 5 minute walk to one of the island's beaches.
reviews.title: Perfect
Close to paradise
reviews.text: Breakfast is the usual you find in Brazil, including cakes, fresh strawberry juice and the best scrambled eggs we had all trip. Guests can use their canoes and there is a boat which takes you to the centre of town (otherwise it's an easy 20-25 minute trek/trail). We saw turtles here too!! The staff are very friendly and helpful.
This is not a boutique hotel but it's certainly a boutique pousada. Highly recommended and do contact me if you want to ask any questions about it!
reviews.title: Romantic place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Whereas Vila do Abraao, the nearest village, can look like a hell (not a beach but a harbor, a crowd of tourists and nothing except pousadas and restaurants), Asalem is very close to paradise... A peaceful environment with the most beautiful landscape I've ever seen from a window, a nice wooden house nearly lost in a great garden, wonderful meals and, above all, the impression of being at home with such nice hosts! They're really helpful and friendly, have free dvd and books to read, kayaks, etc. This place is more expensive than most of the pousadas in Vila do Abraao, but nevertheless, after spending one night in the village, I'm very glad we moved to Asalem for the rest of our stay - and I wish we could stay longer!
reviews.title: Peaceful paradise...
wonderful experience
reviews.text: Alice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Asalem gave us an amazing welcome and never disappointed from there on out. Our bus from Rio was delayed and we caught the last boat to Ilha Grande. It was night and we were tired, hungry, and not sure what to expect next. From the boat, a newly-made acquaintance phoned ahead to Asalem for us. By the time we reached the dock, and before our schooner was even secured, Asalem's little taxi boat pulled up beside us. We threw our luggage onboard and while everybody else started trudging around in the dark looking for their Pousadas, we knew we had already arrived in paradise. After a short ride, we arrive to our room, with the gentle sound of the ocean and a piping hot meal of calamari already waiting for us. It wasn't untll the next morning that we saw the amazing view. This really is an incredible place.
reviews.title: Amazing welcome

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Beds are very comfortable. Staff are super friendly and speak perfectly fluent English, French and German. Rooms are very large with loft sleeping areas. At night, everything is lit with candles.
reviews.title: We love Ilha Grande

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only real drawback is accessibility. By foot, the trail is inaccessible at night or high tide and a bit tricky even at the best of times. A taxi boat costs 15 Real each way for two people. So budget for this. Even if you don't stay here, come for a dinner (need to call ahead). The food/view combination is unbeatable.
reviews.title: Excellent relaxing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What an amazing stay!!! We spent 5 days during our Honeymoon in the Eco-Honeymoon Suite and were absolutely delighted with our stay. The private and tranquil setting was perfect and waking to waterviews every morning through the scrub reminded us it was just another day in paradise. The owner Andre is an interesting and likeable person as is the rest of the Asalem family. The staff are always willing to assist in any way or just to provide great company and a friendly chat. The view from the breakfast table is inspiring and a very enjoyable way to start the day. For dinner you can't go past the fish in coconut sauce...devine. I recommend going out on the speed boat for the day. Asalem provide the driver and you make your own itinerary. Even though it was mid May we had 5 glorious days of sunshine. The 24hr boat service makes it worth staying out of the main town Abrao. Definitely a place to return to.
reviews.title: Heavenly location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Wonderful location, a bit secluded but still close to Abrao. Owner André and staff are taking good care of its guests with special attention. The chef is not in all days but when so it is the case, make sure to eat at the place; homecooking in its core. Nice designed rooms and the honeymoon suite looks great. There was some partying in the bay on a boat one full night but that was not common according to Asalem. Only four rooms but still some thin walls between the rooms. We stayed five nights and loved the extraordinary view, breakfast and ambience. Good weather helps of course.
reviews.title: Amazing Pousada!

reviews.text: Exceptional service! Situated in a stunning spot with its own private beach, Quiet, comfortable and well thought out accomodation with striking views of the island. Very hospitable owners offering a "home from home environment". Multilingual staff, very professional and helpful, nothing was too much trouble for them. All ages welcome. I would wholeheartedly recommend this Pousada to anyone wishing to visit Ilha Grande, Rio.
reviews.title: Asalem

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Peaceful and harmony. They take care carefuly of every detail of tourism. Every single person on this hotel is avocated to make your stay be as good as you expect it and more.
reviews.title: SUPERB

reviews.text: When you get to the hotel you think "there´s no TV.." but after a few hours in the Hotel you realize that: You watch TV anywhere you want anytime, but here you are to connect with nature and confort in the middle of a caribean type island. THANKS YOU SO MUCH FOR THIS EXPERIENCE
reviews.title: Iain

reviews.text: Amazing location. Friendly staff. Great cocktails. Very relaxing. Thanks Andre and co.
reviews.title: Excellent location but......

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel has an excellent location as it is on the side of the island and therefore very quiet with a beautiful view.
reviews.title: Not recommended

description: ASALEM is a seaside hideaway situated in Ilha Grande, a protected reserve of natural land where no cars are allowed. All our 5 enchanting waterfront suites are surrounded by the rain forest that overlooks the spectacular Bay of Abraäo. This proximity to the ocean offers rare, intimate glimpses of sea creatures such as starfish and turtles, as well as abundant schools of fish. The forest brings frequent visitors, including monkeys, squirrels, fireflies, blue butterflies and a wide variety of exotic tropical birds. This unspoiled peace of paradise is the perfect spot for honeymooners looking for privacy: we are 20 minutes apart from the main village walking in an accessible path or 5 minutes by the taxi boat we provide. Apart from the taxi boat service, available 24/7, we can arrange boat trips, transfers, massages, scuba diving, snorkeling and guided hikes.
